oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |a!kunta (Stoffel) (I)
||kabbo (Jantje) (II)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Words and sentences, principally concerning daily life, including a lion killing a man and going into the heavens (289). 1) This story contains many notes on the verso pages concerning names of |xam, their genealogies, the names of places where they come from and the names of different groups of |xam (see pp.114v, 221v and 270v), 2) p.305v: the |xam name for a lion used by children, 3) p.315v: insert: a letter addressed to 'Dr Bleek Mowbray' concerning |xam vocabulary, 4) Notes were added later throughout October 1871 (see pp.250v-255v), 5) Words and sentences by ||kabbo (Jantje) were added throughout February 1871 (see p.268), 6) This story is found in Book I and Book II.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wilhelm Bleek notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Words and sentences (dictionary and genealogies)
